homework5

Class Dictionary

  • java.lang.Object
    • homework5.Dictionary

  • public class Dictionary
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates a dictionary.

    It receives the files that will be used to create a dictionary, reads them, and creates semantic descriptors for all the words that have appeared in, at least, in one of the read files.

    A dictionary is, in essence, a HashMap that has each of the aforementioned words as keys, and another HashMap, that is their vector, as the value assigned to the key.

    Author:
    Marios Pafitis, Stavroulla Koumou

      • getSentenceLists

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getSentenceLists(java.lang.String filename)
        Reads the book with the use of the Scanner Class, breaks down each sentence into the words that make it up, and saves said words into ArrayLists.

        Each sentence is an ArrayList, that belongs to a bigger ArrayList which represents the book (file) that the sentences were read from.

        Parameters:
        filename - the book (file) to be read;
        Returns:
        ArrayList> an ArrayList which represents the read book (file) that contains sentences broken down into words in the form of ArrayLists;

      • build_semantic_descriptors

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer>> build_semantic_descriptors(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>>> books)
        Creates the semantic descriptor vectors of all the books (files) that have been read.

        A word's semantic descriptor vector is created by locating all the sentences that the word appears in, and counting the appearance of each of the rest of the words in the aforementioned sentences; the numbers of the appearance of each, are the vector's coordinates.

        Parameters:
        books - the books (files) that have been read;
        Returns:
        HashMap> the semantic descriptor vectors of all the words that appear at least once in the read books (files);
